alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clinton; Delaware; Fountain; Hamilton; Howard; Madison; Montgomery; Parke; Tipton; Vermillion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Madison, southern Fountain, northern Delaware, southeastern Clinton, southeastern Howard, northwestern Parke, Boone, Hamilton, Tipton, northern Vermillion and Montgomery Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Swayzee to 7 miles southwest of Tipton to 7 miles east of Georgetown. Movement was east-southeast at 45 mph. Stronger winds will likely occur out ahead of the rain perhaps by as much as 10 minutes. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Tipton around 450 PM EDT. Noblesville around 455 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Elwood, Alexandria and Anderson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 131 and 150. Interstate 69 between mile markers 236 and 251. Interstate 74 between mile markers 27 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and east central Indiana.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Clinton; Delaware; Fountain; Hamilton; Howard; Madison; Montgomery; Parke; Tipton; Vermillion
